FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE KINEMATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText: Mote Farm Service provides annual employee training to address health, safety, and emergency measures regarding the farm chemicals they work with on a daily basis.  Mote Farm Service works with the local fire department to keep them up-to-date as to the chemicals on-site, how to address an emergency situation involving any of the chemicals, and an up-to-date site plan.  All of Mote Farm Service ammonia tanks have the required safety features including color-coordinated shut-off valves, bulkhead protection, and water supply adjacent to ammonia tanks.  Mote Farm Service is located in a rural area of Randolph County, 2.5 miles south of Union City,  IN.  The facility is well-maintained; has emergency information prominently posted on the property; has covered storage for fertilizers; diking for storage tanks; and a limestone and gravel base under the entire facility.  Mote Farm Service provides fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides for the local farming community.  Mote Farm Services adheres to all OSHA PSM rules; follows the directives of the State chemists Office; and EPA CEPPO standards.  Mote Farm Service has no history of accidental spills or releases within the last 5 years.  Mote Farm Service has a written Emergency Response Plan, annual employee training, files an annual report with the Randolph County LEPC and local responders.  Mote Farm Services complies with all current rules and regulations set forth by the State Chemist Office.  Mote Farm Services maintains their facility to assure that all safety measures are in place and functioning.
